005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.simulation;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.AllianceStationID;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.DriverStationJNI;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.simulation.DriverStationDataJNI;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.simulation.NotifyCallback;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
013
014/** Class to control a simulated driver station. */
015public final class DriverStationSim {
016  private DriverStationSim() {
017    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("This is a utility class!");
018  }
019
020  /**
021   * Register a callback on whether the DS is enabled.
022   *
023   * @param callback the callback that will be called whenever the enabled state is changed
024   * @param initialNotify if true, the callback will be run on the initial value
025   * @return the {@link CallbackStore} object associated with this callback. Save a reference to
026   *     this object so GC doesn't cancel the callback.
027   */
028  public static CallbackStore registerEnabledCallback(
029      NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
030    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerEnabledCallback(callback, initialNotify);
031    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelEnabledCallback);
032  }
033
034  /**
035   * Check if the DS is enabled.
036   *
037   * @return true if enabled
038   */
039  public static boolean getEnabled() {
040    return DriverStationDataJNI.getEnabled();
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Change whether the DS is enabled.
045   *
046   * @param enabled the new value
047   */
048  public static void setEnabled(boolean enabled) {
049    DriverStationDataJNI.setEnabled(enabled);
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Register a callback on whether the DS is in autonomous mode.
054   *
055   * @param callback the callback that will be called on autonomous mode entrance/exit
056   * @param initialNotify if true, the callback will be run on the initial value
057   * @return the {@link CallbackStore} object associated with this callback. Save a reference to
058   *     this object so GC doesn't cancel the callback.
059   */
060  public static CallbackStore registerAutonomousCallback(
061      NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
062    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerAutonomousCallback(callback, initialNotify);
063    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelAutonomousCallback);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Check if the DS is in autonomous.
068   *
069   * @return true if autonomous
070   */
071  public static boolean getAutonomous() {
072    return DriverStationDataJNI.getAutonomous();
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Change whether the DS is in autonomous.
077   *
078   * @param autonomous the new value
079   */
080  public static void setAutonomous(boolean autonomous) {
081    DriverStationDataJNI.setAutonomous(autonomous);
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Register a callback on whether the DS is in test mode.
086   *
087   * @param callback the callback that will be called whenever the test mode is entered or left
088   * @param initialNotify if true, the callback will be run on the initial value
089   * @return the {@link CallbackStore} object associated with this callback. Save a reference to
090   *     this object so GC doesn't cancel the callback.
091   */
092  public static CallbackStore registerTestCallback(NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
093    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerTestCallback(callback, initialNotify);
094    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelTestCallback);
095  }
096

098   * Check if the DS is in test.
099   *
100   * @return true if test
101   */
102  public static boolean getTest() {
103    return DriverStationDataJNI.getTest();
104  }
105

107   * Change whether the DS is in test.
108   *
109   * @param test the new value
110   */
111  public static void setTest(boolean test) {

113  }

122   */

124      NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
125    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerEStopCallback(callback, initialNotify);
126    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelEStopCallback);
127  }

136  }

139   * Set whether eStop is active.
140   *

142   */
143  public static void setEStop(boolean eStop) {

145  }

157    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerFmsAttachedCallback(callback, initialNotify);
158    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelFmsAttachedCallback);

189    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerDsAttachedCallback(callback, initialNotify);
190    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelDsAttachedCallback);

211  /**
212   * Register a callback on the alliance station ID.
213   *
214   * @param callback the callback that will be called whenever the alliance station changes
215   * @param initialNotify if true, the callback will be run on the initial value
216   * @return the {@link CallbackStore} object associated with this callback. Save a reference to
217   *     this object so GC doesn't cancel the callback.
218   */
219  public static CallbackStore registerAllianceStationIdCallback(
220      NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
221    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerAllianceStationIdCallback(callback, initialNotify);
222    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelAllianceStationIdCallback);
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Get the alliance station ID (color + number).
227   *
228   * @return the alliance station color and number
229   */
230  public static AllianceStationID getAllianceStationId() {
231    return switch (DriverStationDataJNI.getAllianceStationId()) {
232      case DriverStationJNI.kUnknownAllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Unknown;
233      case DriverStationJNI.kRed1AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Red1;
234      case DriverStationJNI.kRed2AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Red2;
235      case DriverStationJNI.kRed3AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Red3;
236      case DriverStationJNI.kBlue1AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Blue1;
237      case DriverStationJNI.kBlue2AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Blue2;
238      case DriverStationJNI.kBlue3AllianceStation -> AllianceStationID.Blue3;
239      default -> AllianceStationID.Unknown;
240    };
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Change the alliance station.
245   *
246   * @param allianceStationId the new alliance station
247   */
248  public static void setAllianceStationId(AllianceStationID allianceStationId) {
249    int allianceStation =
250        switch (allianceStationId) {
251          case Unknown -> DriverStationJNI.kUnknownAllianceStation;
252          case Red1 -> DriverStationJNI.kRed1AllianceStation;
253          case Red2 -> DriverStationJNI.kRed2AllianceStation;
254          case Red3 -> DriverStationJNI.kRed3AllianceStation;
255          case Blue1 -> DriverStationJNI.kBlue1AllianceStation;
256          case Blue2 -> DriverStationJNI.kBlue2AllianceStation;
257          case Blue3 -> DriverStationJNI.kBlue3AllianceStation;
258        };
259    DriverStationDataJNI.setAllianceStationId(allianceStation);
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Register a callback on match time.
264   *
265   * @param callback the callback that will be called whenever match time changes
266   * @param initialNotify if true, the callback will be run on the initial value
267   * @return the {@link CallbackStore} object associated with this callback. Save a reference to
268   *     this object so GC doesn't cancel the callback.
269   */
270  public static CallbackStore registerMatchTimeCallback(
271      NotifyCallback callback, boolean initialNotify) {
272    int uid = DriverStationDataJNI.registerMatchTimeCallback(callback, initialNotify);
273    return new CallbackStore(uid, DriverStationDataJNI::cancelMatchTimeCallback);
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Get the current value of the match timer.
278   *
279   * @return the current match time
280   */
281  public static double getMatchTime() {
282    return DriverStationDataJNI.getMatchTime();
283  }
284
285  /**
286   * Sets the match timer.
287   *
288   * @param matchTime the new match time
289   */
290  public static void setMatchTime(double matchTime) {
291    DriverStationDataJNI.setMatchTime(matchTime);
292  }
293
294  /** Updates DriverStation data so that new values are visible to the user program. */
295  public static void notifyNewData() {
296    int handle = WPIUtilJNI.createEvent(false, false);
297    DriverStationJNI.provideNewDataEventHandle(handle);
298    DriverStationDataJNI.notifyNewData();
299    try {
300      WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(handle);
301    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
302      e.printStackTrace();
303    }
304    DriverStationJNI.removeNewDataEventHandle(handle);
305    WPIUtilJNI.destroyEvent(handle);
306    DriverStation.refreshData();
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Sets suppression of DriverStation.reportError and reportWarning messages.
311   *
312   * @param shouldSend If false then messages will be suppressed.
313   */
314  public static void setSendError(boolean shouldSend) {
315    DriverStationDataJNI.setSendError(shouldSend);
316  }
317
318  /**
319   * Sets suppression of DriverStation.sendConsoleLine messages.
320   *
321   * @param shouldSend If false then messages will be suppressed.
322   */
323  public static void setSendConsoleLine(boolean shouldSend) {
324    DriverStationDataJNI.setSendConsoleLine(shouldSend);
325  }
326
327  /**
328   * Gets the joystick outputs.
329   *
330   * @param stick The joystick number
331   * @return The joystick outputs
332   */
333  public static long getJoystickOutputs(int stick) {
334    return DriverStationDataJNI.getJoystickOutputs(stick);
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Gets the joystick rumble.
339   *
340   * @param stick The joystick number
341   * @param rumbleNum Rumble to get (0=left, 1=right)
342   * @return The joystick rumble value
343   */
344  public static int getJoystickRumble(int stick, int rumbleNum) {
345    return DriverStationDataJNI.getJoystickRumble(stick, rumbleNum);
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * Sets the state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
350   *
351   * @param stick The joystick number
352   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1
353   * @param state The state of the joystick button
354   */
355  public static void setJoystickButton(int stick, int button, boolean state) {
356    DriverStationDataJNI.setJoystickButton(stick, button, state);
357  }
358
359  /**
360   * Gets the value of the axis on a joystick.
361   *
362   * @param stick The joystick number
363   * @param axis The analog axis number
364   * @param value The value of the axis on the joystick
365   */
366  public static void setJoystickAxis(int stick, int axis, double value) {
367    DriverStationDataJNI.setJoystickAxis(stick, axis, value);
368  }
369
370  /**
371   * Gets the state of a POV on a joystick.
372   *
373   * @param stick The joystick number
374   * @param pov The POV number
375   * @param value the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 for not pressed
376   */
377  public static void setJoystickPOV(int stick, int pov, int value) {
378    DriverStationDataJNI.setJoystickPOV(stick, pov, value);
379  }
380
381  /**
382   * Sets the state of all the buttons on a joystick.
383   *
384   * @param stick The joystick number
385   * @param buttons The bitmap state of the buttons on the joystick
386   */
387  public static void setJoystickButtons(int stick, int buttons) {
388    DriverStationDataJNI.setJoystickButtonsValue(stick, buttons);
389  }
390
391  /**
392   * Sets the number of axes for a joystick.

396   */
397  public static void setJoystickAxisCount(int stick, int count) {
398    DriverStationDataJNI.setJoystickAxisCount(stick, count);
399  }

478  }
479
480  /**
481   * Sets the match type.
482   *
483   * @param type the match type
484   */
485  public static void setMatchType(DriverStation.MatchType type) {
486    int matchType =
487        switch (type) {
488          case Practice -> 1;
489          case Qualification -> 2;
490          case Elimination -> 3;
491          case None -> 0;
492        };
493    DriverStationDataJNI.setMatchType(matchType);
494  }
495
496  /**
497   * Sets the match number.
498   *
499   * @param matchNumber the match number
500   */
501  public static void setMatchNumber(int matchNumber) {
502    DriverStationDataJNI.setMatchNumber(matchNumber);
503  }
504
505  /**
506   * Sets the replay number.
507   *
508   * @param replayNumber the replay number
509   */
510  public static void setReplayNumber(int replayNumber) {
511    DriverStationDataJNI.setReplayNumber(replayNumber);
512  }
513
514  /** Reset all simulation data for the Driver Station. */
515  public static void resetData() {
516    DriverStationDataJNI.resetData();
517  }
518}
